intro: Pratia fangiana, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Pratia fangiana is often found in shaded, humid environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
